org.chronos.chronodb.internal.impl.index.diff

Interface IndexValueDiff

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    MutableIndexValueDiff

    public interface IndexValueDiff

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.Set<java.lang.Object> getAdditions(java.lang.String indexName)
      Returns the value additions for the given index name.
      java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getChangedIndices()
      Returns the set of indices that have actual changes in this diff.
      java.lang.Object getNewValue()
      Returns the "new" (next) value, i.e. the "right" side of the diff.
      java.lang.Object getOldValue()
      Returns the "old" (previous) value, i.e. the "left" side of the diff.
      java.util.Set<java.lang.Object> getRemovals(java.lang.String indexName)
      Returns the value removals for the given index name.
      boolean isAdditive()
      Checks if all changes in this diff are additive (contains only additions, but no removals).
      boolean isEmpty()
      Checks if this diff is empty, i.e. does not contain any changes.
      default boolean isEntryAddition()
      Checks if this diff represents an entry addition, i.e. the old value is null and the new value is non-null.
      default boolean isEntryRemoval()
      Checks if this diff represents an entry removal, i.e. the old value is non- null and the new value is null.
      default boolean isEntryUpdate()
      Checks if this diff represents an entry update, i.e. the old value is non- null and the new value is non-null.
      boolean isIndexChanged(java.lang.String indexName)
      Checks if there are changes in this diff for the index with the given name.
      boolean isMixed()
      Checks if the changes in this diff are mixed (contains additions as well as removals).
      boolean isSubtractive()
      Checks if all changes in this diff are subtractive (contains only removals, but no additions).

    • Method Detail

      • getOldValue

        java.lang.Object getOldValue()
        Returns the "old" (previous) value, i.e. the "left" side of the diff.

        If the old value is null and the new value is non-null, then this diff represents an entry addition.

        Returns:
        The old value. May be null.

      • getNewValue

        java.lang.Object getNewValue()
        Returns the "new" (next) value, i.e. the "right" side of the diff.

        If the old value is null and the new value is non-null, then this diff represents an entry addition.

        Returns:
        The new value. May be null.

      • getAdditions

        java.util.Set<java.lang.Object> getAdditions(java.lang.String indexName)
        Returns the value additions for the given index name.
        Parameters:
        indexName - The index name to get the additions for. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        The value additions. Never null. May be empty if nothing was added to the given index.

      • getRemovals

        java.util.Set<java.lang.Object> getRemovals(java.lang.String indexName)
        Returns the value removals for the given index name.
        Parameters:
        indexName - The index name to get the removals for. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        The value removals. Never null. May be empty if nothing was removed from the given index.

      • getChangedIndices

        java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getChangedIndices()
        Returns the set of indices that have actual changes in this diff.

        This is equivalent to the set of indices where the set of additions and/or the set of removals is non-empty.

        Returns:
        The set of names of changed indices. May be empty if this diff is empty, but never null.

      • isIndexChanged

        boolean isIndexChanged(java.lang.String indexName)
        Checks if there are changes in this diff for the index with the given name.
        Parameters:
        indexName - The name of the index to check for changes. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        true if there are changes to the index with the given name, otherwise false.

      • isEmpty

        boolean isEmpty()
        Checks if this diff is empty, i.e. does not contain any changes.

        If this method returns true, then getChangedIndices() all of the following methods will return the empty set:

        • getChangedIndices()
        • getAdditions(String) (for every non-null argument string)
        • getRemovals(String) (for every non-null argument string)

        Please note that any given diff can either be additive, subtractive, mixed or empty. Every diff will return true for exactly one of these states.

        Returns:
        true if this is an empty diff, otherwise false.

      • isEntryAddition

        default boolean isEntryAddition()
        Checks if this diff represents an entry addition, i.e. the old value is null and the new value is non-null.

        Please note that isEntryAddition() and isEntryRemoval() will both return false if both the old value and the new value are null. In any other case, either isEntryAddition() or isEntryRemoval() will return true, but never both of them.

        Returns:
        true if this diff represents an entry addition, otherwise false.

      • isEntryRemoval

        default boolean isEntryRemoval()
        Checks if this diff represents an entry removal, i.e. the old value is non- null and the new value is null.

        Please note that isEntryAddition() and isEntryRemoval() will both return false if both the old value and the new value are null. In any other case, either isEntryAddition() or isEntryRemoval() will return true, but never both of them.

        Returns:
        true if this diff represents an entry removal, otherwise false.

      • isEntryUpdate

        default boolean isEntryUpdate()
        Checks if this diff represents an entry update, i.e. the old value is non- null and the new value is non-null.
        Returns:
        true if this diff represents an entry update, otherwise false.

      • isAdditive

        boolean isAdditive()
        Checks if all changes in this diff are additive (contains only additions, but no removals).

        In other words, this method will return true if and only if all of the following conditions hold:

        • getChangedIndices() returns a non-empty set
        • getAdditions(String) will return a non-empty set for at least one index name
        • getRemovals(String) will return the empty set, for all index names

        Please note that any given diff can either be additive, subtractive, mixed or empty. Every diff will return true for exactly one of these states.

        Returns:
        true if this diff is additive, otherwise false.
        See Also:
        isSubtractive(), isMixed(), isEmpty()

      • isSubtractive

        boolean isSubtractive()
        Checks if all changes in this diff are subtractive (contains only removals, but no additions).

        In other words, this method will return true if and only if all of the following conditions hold:

        • getChangedIndices() returns a non-empty set
        • getAdditions(String) will return the empty set, for all index names
        • getRemovals(String) will return a non-empty set for at least one index name

        Please note that any given diff can either be additive, subtractive, mixed or empty. Every diff will return true for exactly one of these states.

        Returns:
        true if this diff is subtractive, otherwise false.
        See Also:
        isAdditive(), isMixed(), isEmpty()

      • isMixed

        boolean isMixed()
        Checks if the changes in this diff are mixed (contains additions as well as removals).

        In other words, this method will return true if and only if all of the following conditions hold:

        • getChangedIndices() returns a non-empty set
        • getAdditions(String) will return a non-empty set for at least one index name
        • getRemovals(String) will return a non-empty set for at least one index name

        Please note that any given diff can either be additive, subtractive, mixed or empty. Every diff will return true for exactly one of these states.

        Returns:
        true if this diff is mixed, otherwise false.
        See Also:
        isAdditive(), isSubtractive(), isEmpty()
